Line 5: Line 5:
Facebook retains 30% and developers get 70% of all revenue earned through Credits.<ref>[http://news.cnet.com/8301-13577_3-10460201-36.html "Facebook to developers: Get ready for Credits"]. CNET. Retrieved July 13, 2010.</ref> Credits is a single currency that can be used in multiple games and applications, and its introduction led former [[PayPal]] executives to comment on whether or not Credits could soon replace PayPal as the leader in virtual payments.<ref>[http://www.insidefacebook.com/2010/06/11/former-paypal-leaders-debate-can-facebook-credits-replace-paypal/ "Former PayPal Leaders Debate: Can Facebook Credits Replace PayPal?"]. Inside Facebook. Retrieved July 13, 2010.</ref> By the end of 2010, it was expected that Facebook users would purchase Credits to pay for the majority of virtual goods sold on the social network.<ref name ="NYT" />
